title: Utilities Flat as War Fears Spur Safe Havens — Utilities Roundup
text:
Shares of power producers were more or less flat as traders rotated into safe havens amid talk of regional war in the wake of an attack on Saudi Arabia by Iranian-supported Yemeni rebels.

Texas pipeline giant Energy Transfer agreed to buy smaller rival SemGroup in a deal for cash and securities with an overall value, including debt, of about $5 billion.

Write to Rob Curran at rob.curran@dowjones.com

(END) Dow Jones Newswires

September 16, 2019 17:38 ET (21:38 GMT)
